channel.title: AI & Telecom News Digest
channel.description: Daily AI & Telecom insights curated by n8n + Perplexity

item.title: Untitled
item.description: By 2025, half of telecom companies have adopted generative AI, reflecting significant industry growth in AI integration.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: GenAI adoption in telecoms surged, reaching nearly 300 implementations by November 2024, highlights STL Partners.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The 2025 global telecommunications outlook highlights generative AI as a key growth driver, with telcos exploring ways to capitalize on its rising industry impact.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Tredence highlights how generative AI is revolutionizing telecom by improving customer experiences, optimizing networks, and fueling industry innovation.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The article lists the top 26 generative AI development companies in October 2025, highlighting their expertise in ChatGPT, LLMs, and AI-driven business growth solutions.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: A 2024 Nvidia study found nearly 90% of telecom companies use AI, with 48% piloting and 41% actively deploying it, highlighting IBM's sector involvement.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The telco sector faces increasing risks from AI challenges, ineffective digital transformation, and a shifting geopolitical landscape, impacting its future stability and growth.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: A new report highlights that 83% of telecom leaders fear lagging behind, urging telcos to adopt Gen AI to achieve productivity gains desired by 63% of them.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: PwC's 2025 AI Business Predictions highlight key trends and strategies driving AI's transformative impact across industries.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Generative AI, combined with zero trust and quantum encryption, is driving the next growth wave in telecom enterprise security through AI-native platforms.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The 2025 TMT conference in San Francisco highlighted emerging generative AI trends transforming technology, media, and telecom industries.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Malaysia launches Ryt Bank, its first AI-powered bank, while Google's Veo 3 AI video tools become widely available, highlighting AI's transformative impact on industries.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: TMT sectors are poised for major growth by 2025, driven by rapid generative AI adoption and telecommunications advancements.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: An MIT report reveals that 95% of generative AI pilot projects at companies are failing, highlighting significant challenges in AI adoption.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Leading telecom companies are rapidly adopting agentic AI to accelerate transformation and enhance operational efficiency in the evolving Technology, Media & Telecommunications landscape.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Altman Solon analyzes the critical trends and strategic considerations driving generative AI adoption in the telecommunications industry.
